section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: This chapter is promulgated pursuant to State Government Article, §10-304, Annotated Code of Maryland, for the purpose of establishing procedures by which the public may petition the Department of Commerce for a declaratory ruling.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Department" means the Department of Commerce.
"Secretary" means the Secretary of Commerce or the Secretary's designee.

section.heading: Who May File.
section.text: Any interested person may file a petition for declaratory ruling with respect to the manner in which the Department would apply a regulation or order of the Department or a statute that the Department enforces to a person or property on the facts set forth in the petition.

section.heading: Where to File.
section.text: A petition shall be filed with the Secretary for consideration and disposition.

para.text: Be in writing;
Contain a detailed statement of the facts on which the petition is based;
Fully set forth the regulations or statutes involved;
Pose the question of whether, and in what manner, the regulations or statutes apply to the petitioner under the facts contained in the petition;
Contain the name, address, and telephone number of the petitioner; and
Contain a statement by the petitioner, under oath, that the facts contained in the petition are true.
The Secretary:
Shall consider the petition;
May require argument on the petition; and
May issue the declaratory ruling requested or deny the petition.
A declaratory ruling is binding upon the agency and the petitioner, to the extent permitted by law, on the facts alleged.
Any declaratory ruling issued shall:
Be in writing; and
State the reasons for the decision.
A copy of the declaratory ruling shall be delivered to the petitioner.
The Department shall maintain a file of all petitions submitted and the declaratory rulings issued.
This file shall be available for public inspection to the extent permitted by law.
